sources.title: The Dark Mirror
sources.description: Title: The Dark Mirror Summary: A man is found murdered, with witnesses convinced about the woman they saw leaving his apartment. However, it becomes apparent that the woman has a twin, and finding out which one is the killer seems impossible. Directed by: Robert Siodmak Actors: Olivia de Havilland, Lew Ayres, Thomas Mitchell Production Company: International Pictures (I) Release Date: 1947 (Turkey) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A woman suspected of murdering her doctor boyfriend has an identical twin sister. When both twins have an alibi for the night of the murder, a psychiatrist is called in to assist a detective in solving the case. Through a series of tests, he discovers which twin actually committed the crime and in the course of his investigation he falls in love with the normal twin.

sources.title: The Dark Mirror (1946) [720p High Res.] Directed By Robert Siodmak, Starring Olivia De Havilland, Lew Ayres
sources.description: The Dark Mirror is a 1946 American FILM NOlR psychological thriller film directed by Robert Siodmak starring Olivia de Havilland as twins and Lew Ayres as their psychiatrist. It is representative of a Hollywood genre emerging in the 1940s concerning Abnormal Psychology and its treatment through Psychoanalysis .   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and D for Doom and Film Noir Board .

sources.title: The Dark Mirror (1946)
sources.description: A sister and her disturbed twin are implicated in a murder and a police detective must figure out which one's the killer. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/the-dark-mirror-1946/

sources.title: The Dark Mirror (1946 Film-Noir) with Olivia de Havilland | Directed by Robert Siodmak
sources.description:
Twins! One who loves... and one who loves to kill!
Identical twins Terry and Ruth Collins (Olivia de Havilland) become suspects in a perplexing murder, leading Detective Stevenson (Thomas Mitchell) and psychiatrist Dr. Scott Elliott (Lew Ayres) into a web of deception. As Dr. Elliott delves into their intertwined psyches, he must discern which sister harbors a deadly secret before it's too late.

Director: Robert Siodmak
Writers: Nunnally Johnson, Vladimir Pozner

Main cast:
Olivia de Havilland – Terry Collins / Ruth Collins
Lew Ayres – Dr. Scott Elliott
Thomas Mitchell – Lt. Stevenson
Richard Long - Rusty
Charles Evans - District Attorney Girard
Garry Owen - Franklin
Lela Bliss - Mrs. Didriksen
Lester Allen - George Benson
William Halligan - Sergeant Temple
Ida Moore - Mrs. O'Brien
Charles McAvoy - Janitor O'Brien
Marta Mitrovich - Miss Beade

Genres: Crime, Drama, Film-Noir, Horror, Mystery, Psychological Thriller
Release date: October 18, 1946 (NYC premiere)
Filming location: Los Angeles, California, USA


0:00:00 Full Movie with subtitles
0:01:28 A man is found murdered, and Detective Stevenson begins investigating the mysterious case.
0:12:45 Dr. Scott uncovers that identical twins, Terry and Ruth Collins, are suspects in the murder.
0:25:30 Terry manipulates Ruth into switching identities to confuse the investigation.
0:38:15 Dr. Scott uses psychological tests to differentiate the twins and uncover the truth.
0:51:50 Ruth begins to suspect Terry's dangerous intentions and confronts her.
1:05:20 Terry's jealousy and instability escalate, leading to a shocking confrontation.
1:18:00 Detective Stevenson and Dr. Scott set a trap to expose the real murderer.


@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: A woman suspected of murdering her doctor boyfriend has an identical twin sister. When both twins have an alibi for the night of the murder, a psychiatrist is called in to assist a detective in solving the case. Through a series of tests, he discovers which twin actually committed the crime, and in the course of his investigation he falls in love with one of them.
metadata.Actors: Olivia de Havilland, Lew Ayres, Thomas Mitchell
